title: Doubly triangular number
summary: In mathematics, the doubly triangular numbers are the numbers that appear within the sequence of triangular numbers, in positions that are also triangular numbers. That is, if T n = n ( n + 1 ) / 2 {\displaystyle T_{n}=n(n+1)/2} denotes the n {\displaystyle n} th triangular number, then the doubly triangular numbers are the numbers of the form T T n {\displaystyle T_{T_{n}}} .
